section.title: &kw-hos-tm;: OpenStack Services
section.para: &kw-hos; is based on the OpenStack offering which brings many benefits:

listitem.para: OpenStack is a proven infrastructure-as-a-service platform used by many enterpises.
OpenStack has an open, well-defined, modular API architecture that facilitates the integration with infrastructure and management products, such as HPE 3PAR StoreServ or HPE OneView.
OpenStack is designed to easily extend to support new hardware, software, and identity services, while allowing for massive scalability.

section.para: The following table provides a brief summary of the OpenStack services on which &kw-hos; is based.

entry.para: Dashboard (Horizon)

The HPE OpenStack Horizon dashboard provides administrators and users a Web based self-service portal to access, provision and automate cloud-based resources. The extensible design makes it easy to plug in and expose third party products and services, such as billing, monitoring and additional management tools.
Compute (Nova)

HPE Compute Operation services, based on OpenStack Nova, provide services and associated libraries for massively scalable, on-demand, self-service access to compute resources, including bare metal, virtual machines, and containers.
Image (Glance)

HPE Image services, based on OpenStack Glance, provide a service where users can upload and discover data assets that are meant to be used with other services, like images for Nova and templates for Heat.
Networking (Neutron)
HPE Networking services, based on OpenStack Neutron, provide services and associated libraries for on-demand, scalable, and technology-agnostic network abstraction.
Object Storage (Swift)

HPE Object Storage service, based on OpenStack Swift, is a highly available, distributed, eventually consistent object/blob store. Organizations can use Swift to store lots of data efficiently, safely, and cheaply.
Block Storage (Cinder)

HPE Block Storage Service, based on OpenStack Cinder, implements services and libraries to provide on-demand, self-service access to Block Storage resources via abstraction and automation on top of other block storage devices.
Identity (Keystone)
HPE Identity Service, based on OpenStack Keystone, facilitates API client authentication, service discovery, distributed multi-tenant authorization, and auditing.
Data Collection (Ceilometer)
HPE Data Collection service, based on OpenStack Ceilometer, efficiently collects, normalise and transform data produced by OpenStack services.
Orchestration (Heat)
HPE Orchestration service, based on OpenStack Heat, orchestrates composite cloud applications using a declarative template format through an OpenStack-native REST API.
Bare Metal (Ironic)

HPE Bare Metal service, based on OpenStack Ironic, provides a service and associated libraries capable of managing and provisioning physical machines, and to do this in a security-aware and fault-tolerant manner.
Dashboard (Horizon)
HPE Dashboard, based on OpenStack Horizon, provides an extensible, unified, web based user interface for all OpenStack services.
Monitoring Service (Monasca)

HPE Monitoring Service, based on OpenStack Monasca, provides a multi-tenant, highly scalable, performant, fault-tolerant monitoring-as-a-service solution for metrics, complex event processing and logging.
Backup, Restore, and Disaster Recovery Service (Freeze)
HPE Backup, Restore, and Disaster Recovery Service, based on OpenStack Freezer, provides integrated tools for backing up and restoring cloud data in multiple use cases, including disaster recover.
Key Manager Service (Barbica)
HPE Key Manager Service, based on OpenStack Barbican, produces a secret storage and generation system capable of providing key management for services wishing to enable encryption feature.
Container Service (Magnum)
HPE Container Service, based on OpenStack Magnum, implements container orchestration engines such as Docker Swarm, Kubernetes, and Apache Mesos available as first class resource.
